page.title: 02TRANSPORT-ROADS & FOOTPATHS
page.content:
The 12 square kilometre area is fairly well intersected by roads.
The Northeast corner is crossed by one kilometre of the M6 Motorway, parallel to which at this point runs a similar length of the main Western North-South route of British Rail.
From Hutton End to the North and South runs an unnumbered country road which is nevertheless well maintained and of a fair width. This route is popular for those travelling between Penrith and Carlisle. From Hutton End a similar road runs E. to Calthwaite. These roads total 7km in length.
The remaining roads are paved but narrow, totalling 12km. Surprisingly, the area contains only 1.5km of footpaths.
